name: Ephedrine family
description: Structure-activity map for phenethylamine stimulants and decongestants derived from ephedrine.
notes: Click to see how small functional group edits shift properties across this family.

flowchart.title: Phenethylamine core to ephedrine and cathinone derivatives
flowchart.subtitle: Functional group edits that tune potency, polarity, and pharmacology.

nodes.title: Phenethylamine
nodes.profile: Foundational stimulant backbone with weak adrenergic tone.

nodes.title: Amphetamine
nodes.profile: Central stimulant; dopamine and norepinephrine releasing agent.

nodes.title: Methamphetamine
nodes.profile: Highly lipophilic monoamine releaser with rapid CNS entry.

nodes.title: Norephedrine / PPA
nodes.detail: β-hydroxyl improves polarity and oral use.
nodes.profile: Peripheral sympathomimetic, common in decongestant formulations.

nodes.title: Ephedrine
nodes.detail: N-methyl β-hydroxy pair gives mixed CNS/peripheral activity.
nodes.profile: Mixed-acting sympathomimetic with bronchodilation and mild CNS stimulation.

nodes.title: Cathinone
nodes.detail: β-keto slows BBB penetration versus amphetamine.
nodes.profile: Mild stimulant; reduced potency from slower brain penetration.

nodes.title: Methcathinone
nodes.detail: Adds N-methyl to cathinone for higher potency.

nodes.title: 3-MMC
nodes.profile: Entactogenic stimulant with moderate serotonin release.

nodes.title: 4-MMC (mephedrone)
nodes.profile: Potent entactogen balancing dopamine and serotonin release.

name: Ethanol oxidation ladder
description: Progressive oxidation and derivatization of a simple alcohol to showcase functional group interconversion.
notes: Follow how polarity and reactivity change from alcohol to acid derivatives.

flowchart.title: Alcohol to carbonyl to carboxyl derivatives
flowchart.subtitle: Common lab transformations of ethanol and acetic acid.

nodes.title: Ethanol
nodes.profile: CNS depressant; baseline polar solvent and fuel.

nodes.title: Acetaldehyde
nodes.profile: Reactive aldehyde intermediate with higher toxicity than ethanol.

nodes.title: Acetic acid
nodes.profile: Weak acid; antimicrobial and metabolic intermediate.

nodes.title: Acetyl chloride
nodes.profile: Highly reactive acylating agent; corrosive, not for pharmacologic use.

nodes.title: Acetamide
nodes.profile: Stable amide; low acute pharmacological activity.

nodes.title: Ethyl acetate
nodes.profile: Volatile solvent/ester with fruity aroma; limited bioactivity.

nodes.title: Sodium acetate
nodes.profile: Buffered salt; used in IV solutions and lab buffers.
